bill.title: IVF Parental Protection and Adoption and Ethical Treatment of Human Embryos Act of 2013; create.
bill.description: An Act To Create The In Vitro Fertilization (ivf) Parental Protection And Adoption And Ethical Treatment Of Human Embryos Act Of 2013; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful For Any Person Or Entity To Intentionally Or Knowingly Create Or Attempt To Create A Human-animal Hybrid, To Transfer A Human Embryo Into A Nonhuman Womb, And To Transfer A Nonhuman Embryo Into A Human Womb; To Create New Section 93-18-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 93-18-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Relinquishment Of Rights In And Responsibilities To An Embryo; To Create New Section 93-18-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Expedited Adoption Of An Embryo; To Create New Section 93-18-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For An Expedited Order Of Adoption; To Create New Section 93-30-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 93-30-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Criminalize The Creation Of A Human Embryo By Certain Means; To Create New Section 93-30-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Payment For Creation Of Human Embryos In Certain Circumstances; To Create New Section 93-30-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Unique Identification Of Embryos; To Create New Section 93-30-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enunciate A Standard Of Care For Human Embryos; To Create New Section 93-30-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Set Standards For Facilities Under The Act; To Create New Section 93-30-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The Number Of Human Embryos That May Be Transplanted; To Create New Section 93-30-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Standards According To The Age Of The Person Seeking To Be The Mother Of A Human Embryo; To Create New Section 93-30-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Disputes; To Create New Section 93-30-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Informed Consent On The Part Of Patients; To Create New Section 93-30-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit The Independent Right To Practice In Vitro Fertilization; To Create New Section 93-30-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Criminal Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Welfare;Judiciary, Division A
